_comment: Event Scheduler Configuration - IMPORTANT: Update command paths and arguments for your system. {BBS_ROOT} will be replaced with the BBS installation directory at runtime.

events.name: Example: Every Minute
events.comment: Runs every minute. Cron format: minute hour day month weekday

events.name: Example: Daily Maintenance at 3am
events.comment: Runs at 3:00 AM every day. Format: 0 3 * * * (minute=0, hour=3)

events.name: Example: Simple Binkd Poll
events.comment: Simple binkd poll every 15 minutes (polls all configured nodes). Adjust paths for your system.

events.name: Example: Binkd Poll Specific Node
events.comment: Poll a specific node every 30 minutes. Update command path, node address, and config path for your setup.

events.name: Example: Toss Echomail (jamutil)
events.comment: Toss inbound FTN bundles and .PKT files into JAM message bases every hour. Requires ftn.json to be configured.

events.name: Example: Scan Echomail (jamutil)
events.comment: Scan JAM bases for new outgoing echomail every 5 minutes and create outbound .PKT files. Uses a persistent high-water mark so only new messages are exported each run.

events.name: Example: Pack Echomail Bundles (jamutil)
events.comment: Pack outbound .PKT files into ZIP bundles for binkd to transmit. Runs 2 minutes after scan to ensure packets are ready. BSO day-of-week naming convention.

events.name: Example: Backup with Date Placeholders
events.comment: Daily backup at 2 AM using placeholders for dated filenames

events.name: Example: Run Shell Script with Multiple Commands
events.comment: Run a complex shell script at 4 AM using /bin/sh -c

events.name: Example: Nightly Deleted User Purge
events.comment: Permanently remove soft-deleted user accounts that have exceeded deletedUserRetentionDays (set in config.json, default 30 days). Runs at 3:00 AM. Safe to run daily — accounts not yet past the retention period are left untouched.

events.name: Example: Nightly Message Base Integrity Check
events.comment: Check and repair JAM message base integrity across all areas at 2 AM. Part of a 3-step nightly maintenance sequence: fix → purge → pack.

events.name: Example: Nightly Message Base Purge
events.comment: Purge messages exceeding per-area age/count limits (max_msg_age, max_msgs) configured in message_areas.json. Runs at 2:15 AM between fix and pack. No flags needed — limits are read from config.

events.name: Example: Nightly Message Base Pack
events.comment: Defragment and compact all JAM message bases at 2:30 AM, reclaiming space from purged/deleted messages. Runs last in the nightly sequence.
